verses.text: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite , and said ,
Therefore do my thoughts cause me to answer , and for \add this\add* I make haste.\f + \fr 20.2 \ft I make…: Heb. my haste is in me\f*
I have heard the check of my reproach , and the spirit of my understanding causeth me to answer.
Knowest thou \add not\add* this of old , since man was placed upon earth ,
That the triumphing of the wicked \add is\add* short , and the joy of the hypocrite \add but\add* for a moment ?\f + \fr 20.5 \ft short: Heb. from near\f*
Though his excellency mount up to the heavens , and his head reach unto the clouds ;\f + \fr 20.6 \ft clouds: Heb. cloud\f*
\add Yet\add* he shall perish for ever like his own dung : they which have seen him shall say , Where \add is\add* he?
He shall fly away as a dream , and shall not be found : yea, he shall be chased away as a vision of the night.
The eye also \add which\add* saw him shall \add see him\add* no more ; neither shall his place any more behold him. \p
His children shall seek to please the poor , and his hands shall restore their goods.\f + \fr 20.10 \ft His children…: or, The poor shall oppress his children\f*
His bones are full \add of the sin\add* of his youth , which shall lie down with him in the dust.
Though wickedness be sweet in his mouth , \add though\add* he hide it under his tongue ;
\add Though\add* he spare it, and forsake it not; but keep it still within his mouth :\f + \fr 20.13 \ft within…: Heb. in the midst of his palate\f*
\add Yet\add* his meat in his bowels is turned , \add it is\add* the gall of asps within him.
He hath swallowed down riches , and he shall vomit them up again : God shall cast them out of his belly.
He shall suck the poison of asps : the viper’s tongue shall slay him.
He shall not see the rivers , the floods , the brooks of honey and butter.\f + \fr 20.17 \ft the floods…: or, streaming brooks\f*

That which he laboured for shall he restore , and shall not swallow \add it\add* down : according to \add his\add* substance \add shall\add* the restitution \add be\add*, and he shall not rejoice \add therein\add*.\f + \fr 20.18 \ft his…: Heb. the substance of his exchange\f*
Because he hath oppressed \add and\add* hath forsaken the poor ; \add because\add* he hath violently taken away an house which he builded not;\f + \fr 20.19 \ft oppressed: Heb. crushed\f*
Surely he shall not feel quietness in his belly , he shall not save of that which he desired.\f + \fr 20.20 \ft feel: Heb. know\f*
There shall none of his meat be left ; therefore shall no man look for his goods.\f + \fr 20.21 \ft none…: or, be none left for his meat\f*
In the fulness of his sufficiency he shall be in straits : every hand of the wicked shall come upon him.\f + \fr 20.22 \ft wicked: or, troublesome\f* \p
\add When\add* he is about to fill his belly , \add God\add* shall cast the fury of his wrath upon him, and shall rain \add it\add* upon him while he is eating.
He shall flee from the iron weapon , \add and\add* the bow of steel shall strike him through.
It is drawn , and cometh out of the body ; yea, the glittering sword cometh out of his gall : terrors \add are\add* upon him.
All darkness \add shall be\add* hid in his secret places : a fire not blown shall consume him; it shall go ill with him that is left in his tabernacle.
The heaven shall reveal his iniquity ; and the earth shall rise up against him.
The increase of his house shall depart , \add and his goods\add* shall flow away in the day of his wrath.
This \add is\add* the portion of a wicked man from God , and the heritage appointed unto him by God.\f + \fr 20.29 \ft appointed…: Heb. of his decree from God\f*
